EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter (new factory burner inserter) at Position(2.5, 16.5)
• Dedicated burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) (placed using direction RIGHT)
• Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5)

Use-case: This structure provides the interface for copper cable production by transferring items from the input chest through paired burner inserters into the assembling machine.

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(3.5, 15.5) – crafted and placed to serve as an isolated depot
• Transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) – positioned adjacent to the depot chest for connectivity
• Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (placed using direction UP)

Use-case: This system is designed to isolate and route items from the extraction source by establishing a dedicated belt depot that links via multi‐segment transport belts.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors:
  Ensure that when connecting transport belts the target is not a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always verify the target entity’s type and, if necessary, add an inserter to accept items instead of directly connecting to a steam engine.

• Placement Distance Errors:
  Before attempting to place an entity (such as a wooden chest), move the player close enough so that the target position is within the allowed maximum distance.

• Inventory Shortage Errors:
  Confirm that the necessary item is present in the inventory prior to placement to avoid failures due to missing items.

• Variable Reference Errors:
  Review variable names (for example, replacing undefined ‘target_chest’ with the correct reference) and ensure all variables are properly defined and referenced to prevent NameError exceptions.
